com.bham.bd.components.environment

Class MapLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bham.bd.components.environment.MapLoader

  • public class MapLoader
extends Object
    Class which can load a map specifically created with a Tiled Map Editor
    See Also:
    mapeditor.org

    • Method Detail

      • loadMap

        private void loadMap(String pathToMap)
              throws JSONException
        Loads map with obstacles and triggers

        This method creates a JSON object from a given JSON file and parses any obstacles and triggers it can provide. If the constructors for obstacles or triggers could not be located, they are skipped and the errors are printed out.

        Parameters:
        pathToMap - path to map in JSON format
        Throws:
        JSONException - thrown if some JSON property is requested but is not found in the actual file

      • initMapProperties

        void initMapProperties(JSONObject jsonObject)
                throws JSONException
        Checks the attributes about the map from the given JSON object

        Firstly it checks for a unique offset each tileset starts to ident its tile positions and pushes the values to the OFFSET map. If it is a TRIGGER tileset, tiles' positions are mapped to trigger classes, otherwise, if it is a tileset defined in Tileset, tiles' are checked if they are animated. Otherwise, an error is handled and nothing happens if the tileset is not defined as an enum.

        Parameters:
        jsonObject - JSON object to check
        Throws:
        JSONException

      • convertToObstacles

        public ArrayList<Obstacle> convertToObstacles(String tilesetName,
                                              String tileName,
                                              JSONArray obstacleArray)
                                       throws ClassNotFoundException,
                                              NoSuchMethodException
        Converts JSON object attributes to Obstacles in the map

        This method goes through JSON obstacle array and builds an Obstacle object for every tile based on its position and name. If, for some reason, the ID of the tile could not be located within the defined tileset picture in Tileset enum, the tile is simply skipped and an error is printed. The error is not handled if the constructor of Obstacle cannot be declared.

        Parameters:
        tilesetName - name of the tileset used to take the tile image from
        tileName - name of the class used to create an obstacle
        obstacleArray - array of obstacles in JSON format
        Returns:
        list of obstacles to be added to the game map
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - thrown when no constructor method has been found for Obstacle class
        NoSuchMethodException - thrown if Obstacle cannot be located under com.bham.bd.components.environment package

      • convertToTriggers

        public ArrayList<Trigger> convertToTriggers(String packageName,
                                            JSONArray triggerArray)
                                     throws ClassNotFoundException
        Converts JSON object attributes to Triggers in the map

        This method goes through JSON trigger array and builds a Trigger object for every object based on its ID which is mapped to the trigger's class name. If, for some reason, the parameters of a trigger object are not defined correctly, the trigger is simply skipped and an error is printed. The error is not handled if the constructor of a specific trigger cannot be declared.

        Parameters:
        packageName - name of the class used to create a trigger
        triggerArray - array of triggers in JSON format
        Returns:
        list of triggers to be added to the game map
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - thrown when no constructor method has been found for a specific Trigger class

      • identifyAttributes

        private ArrayList<Attribute> identifyAttributes(String tileName)
        Identifies all the attributes a tile to be converted to obstacle instance should have
        Parameters:
        tileName - name of the tile on which the attributes will depend
        Returns:
        a list of attributes the obstacle should have or WALKABLE attribute by default

        public int getNumTilesY()
        Gets the amount of tiles in Y direction
        Returns:
